name: Networking Fundamentals
description: Welcome to Phase 2! This phase covers the core networking concepts you need before diving into cloud infrastructure. Understanding how networks work—IP addressing, routing, DNS, and common protocols—is essential for cloud engineering. You'll learn to troubleshoot connectivity issues and build a mental model of how data flows across networks.
short_description: Learn core networking: IP/subnetting, routing, DNS, HTTP, ports, and troubleshooting. Build the foundation for cloud networking.
additional_context: These fundamentals apply everywhere—whether you're debugging a local dev environment or architecting cloud infrastructure. Take time to understand the concepts deeply; you'll use this knowledge daily.

capstone.title: Network Troubleshooting Lab
capstone.summary: Diagnose and fix network connectivity issues in a simulated broken environment. Apply your networking knowledge to identify DNS, routing, firewall, and port problems.
includes: Set up a local multi-container environment with intentional network issues
Use ping, traceroute, dig, curl, and netstat to diagnose problems
Document your troubleshooting process and findings
Apply fixes and verify connectivity is restored

hands_on_verification.summary: Demonstrate your networking troubleshooting skills by completing the lab and documenting your process.
includes: Document at least 3 issues found and how you diagnosed them
